

Welcome to the City of Edcouch, Texas. We are glad you are here. Edcouch is a community with tremendous civic pride, a community with a diverse business environment and a city filled with friendly people. Our small town atmosphere makes Edcouch a great place to live or visit.

     If you are a visitor to our city, we hope that you will take some time to explore the unique experiences that Edcouch has to offer. From education to recreation, we believe there is something for everyone here and you will see why we choose to make the city our home.

     If you are a city resident, we encourage you to take the time to learn more about your City and to get involved in your city government. From attending City Council Meetings to volunteering to serve on one of our many boards and commissions, the opportunities abound.

     We are proud of the many successes of our citizens and businesses and of the partnerships that we have developed with them.

     This website will provide you with information about the duties of all Edcouch City Departments and contact information for each, events calendars, city ordinances, city map, parks and recreation information, the list is abundant. Our city employees and I will be glad to assist you in any way.

     On behalf of the City Council and staff, it is my sincere pleasure to welcome you to our City! I am sure you will agree that Edcouch is a great place to call home.

Virginio Gonzalez Jr.

Mayor of Edcouch, TX

About Edcouch

EDCOUCH, TEXAS. Edcouch is at the intersection of State Highway 107 and Farm Road 1015, eighteen miles northeast of McAllen in southeastern Hidalgo County. The townsite was developed in 1927 and named for Edward Couch, landowner and banker.
